intro: Souroubea crassipetala, commonly known as the thick-petaled souroubea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its large, fleshy leaves and clustered, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
